data.text: @RLStollar She and her family may well never feel really safe again, given the kind of hate stirred up by the marginalized speaking truth to power. That’s a huge sacrifice even if no physical harm ever comes of it.
So sorry, but not sorry: until Republicans and evangelicals stop worshipping at the golden calf of Trump, you're just going to have to deal with the politics. 😎
The fact is, the personal is political and the political is personal. As a sexual assault survivor myself I know this all too well.

Ford is bravely warning us about one of these predators, making her personal pain political for our country's health and well-being. She is a patriot for doing so in my book. She's already gone through hell and back for speaking up.
This is a *political* matter, if we are now openly welcoming predators to lead our nation. (Nathan Larson, anyone?)

This is a *political* matter, why the leadership of one of the two major political parties in the U.S. has joined hands with evangelical leaders in busily justifying and/or ignoring the sexual assault of women and children.

This is a *political* matter, whether or not we will have an attempted rapist on the highest court of our country, chosen by a serial abuser of women elected (not by popular vote) to the highest office in the land.
